displayName.text: New York Presbyterian Hospital-Columbia: Cancer Center

formattedAddress: 622 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 622 W 168th St, New York, NY 10032-3720, USA

originalText.text:
Patients are there first preference. There care and support makes us happier and much satisfied.
Amazing scenery and beautiful ambiance with good and nice staffing makes the beauty of this auspicious hospital.

text.text:
Patients are there first preference. There care and support makes us happier and much satisfied.
Amazing scenery and beautiful ambiance with good and nice staffing makes the beauty of this auspicious hospital.

originalText.text: The staff is very unprofessional, if you’re Spanish you will be taken care of. The director takes up for her fraudulent staff, they can do corrupt to you and she ignores it. Oh the nurses pick and choose which patients they want to work with. I never even received a welcoming packet. Oh and if you look young and you’re disabled they will question why you’re not working. Mind you permanently disabled and a RN is questioning you. They laugh at patients and talk about patients negatively. The staff feel they can play in your face and tell you anything. Hey they make you read your own Medical record number for the medication IV you will receive. They will call certain patients from their cellular to remind them of their appointments. Hey what about the others patients. All of them will reap what they sow. Job doesn’t require much  just IV two nurses to identify you as person receiving medication but no they make you read out your own number without asking. Favoritism & Nepotism. Very disgusting disgraceful group of nurses who took an oath. Even gossip about you to other patients in the treatment facility. Grow up. Takes less than 2hrs for treatment and you go home with anxiety a headache and discomfort from the unfairness. Thanks for adding more lesions and stress to my life. Going there was an escape

originalText.text: My Mom went here in 2012 for lung cancer with Dr. Wong.  She survived! It's easy to get in, park, security, not too long waits -if there is they had drink and snacks.  Waiting room with plugs.  It was scary for her but he did an amazing job for her and she was on oxygen many years before this radiation.

originalText.text:
Amazing service. This is huge, very huge. The staff is amazing. The service is incredible to describe. They are the best. It is too easy to arrive, you could take trains like 1, A and  C  Their station is 168 st.
They have building in Broadway ave and Fort Washington ave.
Es enorme y el servicio espectacular. Demasiado increíble para explicar, esta muy fácil para llegar pues tiene acceso a los trenes 1,A,C y rutas variadas de autobuses.
